comments.text:
Created attachment 585078
screenshot demonstrating missing borders on nav toolbar

When you first launch a new profile, the ends of the navigation toolbar are clipped so they have no border. This corrects itself after a couple of window focus changes, but it's an ugly first experience. Screenshot attached. Tested with latest nightly build on win7.

comments.raw_text: Is it clear this is a FF12 regression? If not, I don't think we need to track this minor UI issue. That's not to say we wouldn't take a fix for FF12.

comments.text:
11 or even 10 could be affected as well. We still need to find the regression range.

This is primary UI and part of the first-run experience, so we probably don't want to make compromises here. Depending on what exactly is broken here, this could also have more severe consequences.

This is broken in Firefox 4 as well. It's not clear that this is a regression at this point. The reason this wasn't noticed before is that we usually show the modal default-browser dialog in new profiles and closing that dialog fixes the window.
